name: 陳協慶
objective: This course teaches the basic theory of numerical methods to apply numerical algorithms in solving various types of mathematical problems by using a computer. The content includes error analysis and problem-solving of nonlinear equation (bisection, Newton, secant method), linear and nonlinear systems, curve fitting ( regression, Lagrange interpolation, spline curve), numerical differentiation and integration, ordinary differential equation, optimization, etc.
schedule:
wk1: Introduction to MS Excel & VBA; Bracketing Methods for Locating a Root
wk2: Newton-Raphson and Secant Methods
wk3: Review of Taylor Series; Number Representation; Number Representation and Errors; Error Analysis
wk4: Interpolation and Lagrange Approximation
wk5: Quiz
wk6: Numerical Differentiation Formulas
wk7: Numerical Integration
wk8: Double Integral Method & LV programming tool
wk9: Midterm Exam.
wk10: Gaussian Elimination
wk11: LU Decomposition, Pivoting, and Triangular Factorization
wk12: Curve Fitting and Least-squares
wk13: Interpolation by Spline Function
wk14: Solving Ordinary Differential Equations
wk15: Multidimensional Unconstrained Optimization
wk16: Optimization by the Heuristic Search Method
wk17: Constrained Optimization
wk18: Final Exam.
materials:
1. Numerical Methods for Engineers, Chapra & Canale, McGraw Hill. 
2. Numerical Methods Using MATLAB, Jhon. & Kurtis.
3. Handouts
